conclusion: Identify the given data: gravitational acceleration g = 10 m/s²; acceleration a is a linear function of force F from the graph.
Understand the forces and acceleration: force F causes acceleration a on object A; graph shows a linear relationship a = F/m - μk g.
Graph shows acceleration a as a function of F; y-intercept represents acceleration when F = 0, indicating effect of friction alone.
Y-intercept is -2 m/s² from the graph, due to frictional force: -μk g; therefore, μk g = 2.
Given g = 10 m/s², solve for μk: μk × 10 = 2 implies μk = 0.2.
Slope of the graph represents the mass of object A; slope is 8/60 = 2/15.
Mass of A is m = 2/15 kg⁻¹.
Final answers: coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is 0.2; mass of A is 2/15 kg⁻¹.
